schemas.description: Physical address of the manufacturer.

contents.name: ArticleNumber
contents.description: Alphanumeric character sequence identifying a manufactured, non-configurable product.

contents.name: CountryOfOrigin
contents.description: Country in which the product is manufactured.

contents.name: DayOfConstruction
contents.description: The optional DayOfConstrucition provides the day of the month in which the manufacturing process of the machine has been completed. It shall be a number and never change during the life-cycle of a machine.

contents.name: FabricationNumber
contents.description: Alphanumeric character sequence assigned to a fabricated product, which allows the date, time and circumstances of fabrication to be traced.

contents.name: GTINCode
contents.description: Bar code number that identifies the device based on the Global Trade Item Number system.

contents.name: NationalStockNumber
contents.description: 13-digit numeric code, identifying all 'standardized material items of supply' as recognized by the United States Department of Defense.

contents.name: OrderProductCode
contents.description: Unique combination of numbers and letters used to order the device.

contents.name: PhysicalAddress
contents.description: Physical address of the manufacturer.

contents.name: Supplier
contents.description: Name of the supplier or vendor of a device.

contents.name: TypeOfProduct
contents.description: Characterization of the device based on its usage, operation principle, and its fabricated form.

contents.name: OnOffCycle
contents.description: This property contains the total number of transitions of the value from the Off to the On state.

contents.name: Status
contents.description: This property contains the actual status of the element.

contents.name: DiscreteInputValue
contents.description: This property contains the actual value of the discrete input unit.

contents.name: DiscreteOutputValue
contents.description: This property contains the actual value of the discrete output unit.

contents.name: FaultAction
contents.description: This property determines the action taken on variables in fault state.

contents.name: FaultValue
contents.description: This property specifies a user-defined value for use with Fault action property.

schemas.description: describes the pump kick mode of the pump

contents.name: PumpKickMode
contents.description: This property describes the pump kick mode of the pump.

contents.name: PumpKickTime
contents.description: This property determines the absolute time of a pump kick, if Pump Kick Mode is operator specific. The time for the next pump kick results of the sum of Pump Kick Time and Pump Kick Time Difference

contents.name: PumpKickTimeDifference
contents.description: This property determines the interval time of a pump kick, if Pump Kick Mode is operator specific. The time for the next pump kick results of the sum of Pump Kick Time and Pump Kick Time Difference

contents.name: FaultAction
contents.description: This property determines the action taken on variables in fault state. If the value is TRUE, the value of the property Fault value is used, if it is FALSE, the last valid value is used

contents.name: FaultValue
contents.description: This property specifies a user-defined value for use with Fault action property

contents.name: FeedbackVariable
contents.description: Variable quantity, which represents the controlled variable and is returned to the comparing element

contents.name: ManipulatedValue
contents.description: Output variable of the controlling system, which is also an input variable of the controlled system

contents.name: OnOff
contents.description: This property enables the operation.

contents.name: ReferenceVariable
contents.description: Input variable to a comparing element in a controlling system, which sets the desired value of the controlled variable and is deducted from the command variable

contents.name: Status
contents.description: This property contains the actual status of the element

schemas.description: describes the possible control modes of the pump
describes the possible operation modes of the pump

contents.name: ActualControlMode
contents.description: This property describes the actual control mode of the pump.

contents.name: ActualOperationMode
contents.description: This property describes the actual operation mode of the pump.

contents.name: ControlInversion
contents.description: This property offers the inversion of the selected control mode in operation mode AutoControl. A 'True' status means that the control mode inversion is activated and a 'False' status means that the control mode inversion is deactivated.

contents.name: Enable
contents.description: This property activates of the control function.

contents.name: ExternalSignal
contents.description: This property offers the activation of an external electrical interface serving the setpoint of the control function by selecting the kind of electrical (analogue) signal.

contents.name: ReverseRotatingDirection
contents.description: This property indicates the inversion of the standard rotating direction.

contents.name: SetControlMode
contents.description: This property describes the desired control mode of the pump.

contents.name: SetOperationMode
contents.description: This property describes the desired operation mode of the pump.

contents.name: CleanValveRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for the opening of the clean valve.

contents.name: FlushValveRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for the opening of the flush valve.

contents.name: GasDilValveRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for the opening of the gas dilution valve.

contents.name: InletValveRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for the opening of the inlet valve.

contents.name: OutletValveRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for the opening of the outlet valve.

contents.name: PumpKick
contents.description: This element describes a periodical operation of a pump, avoiding blockage at non operation time.

contents.name: PumpStandByRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for pump standby.

contents.name: PurgeValveRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for the opening of the purge valve.

contents.name: VentValveRequest
contents.description: This element offers a request for the opening of the vent valve.

contents.name: CorrectiveMaintenanceTime
contents.description: Part of the maintenance time when active corrective maintenance is carried out on an item, including technical, logistic and internal administrative delays

contents.name: Criticality
contents.description: Index of the severity of an effect combined with the probability of expected frequency of its occurrence

contents.name: Failure
contents.description: Termination of the ability of an item to perform a required function. A 'True' status means that the pump has a failure and a 'False' status means that the pump has no failure.

contents.name: NumberOfFailures
contents.description: Number of failures of an object

contents.name: Severity
contents.description: Extent of loss, damage or harm caused by a fault or failure

contents.name: Availability
contents.description: Probability that a machine will, when used under specified conditions, operate satisfactorily and effectively

contents.name: Durability
contents.description: Actual reliability of an item considering operating modes, operating conditions and possible preventive maintenance actions carried out

contents.name: ExpectedReliability
contents.description: Reliability of an item determined by design and manufacture under expected conditions of operation and maintenance

contents.name: InstantaneousAvailability
contents.description: Probability that an item is in a state to perform as required at a given instant, under given conditions, assuming that the necessary external resources are provided

contents.name: IntrinsicMaintainability
contents.description: Maintainability of an item determined by the design under expected conditions of maintenance and logistic support

contents.name: IntrinsicReliability
contents.description: Reliability of an item determined by design and manufacture under expected conditions of operation assuming that no preventive maintenance task is carried out, excepting routine maintenance

contents.name: Maintainability
contents.description: Ability of a machine or part of a system to be retained in, or restored to, a state in which it can perform the required function(s)

contents.name: OperationalReliability
contents.description: Actual reliability of an item considering operating modes, operating conditions and possible preventive maintenance actions carried out

contents.name: ProductionBasedAvailability
contents.description: Ratio of actual production to required production, or any other reference level, over a specified period of time

contents.name: Reliability
contents.description: Probability that a machine will perform its required functions without failure for a specified time period when used under specified conditions

contents.name: TimeBasedAvailability
contents.description: During a given period of time, percentage of the time during which an item was able to perform when required

contents.name: Design
contents.description: Static design properties for a pump.

contents.name: Implementation
contents.description: Static implementation properties for a pump.

contents.name: SystemRequirements
contents.description: Static system requirement properties for a pump.

contents.name: NominalPressure
contents.description: Alphanumeric parameter for reference purposes, referring to a combination of mechanical and dimensional properties of a component of a piping system. It comprises the letters PN followed by a dimensionless number.

contents.name: CriticalBackingPressure
contents.description: Maximum backing pressure for which the conditions are defined in the instruction manual or in a specific standard for the particular vacuum pump.

contents.name: InletAreaOfThePump
contents.description: Free cross-sectional area of the entry opening in the inlet connection of the pump.

contents.name: MaximumAllowableInletPressure
contents.description: Highest value of inlet pressure at which the pump or component is capable of functioning on the basis of the materials used.

contents.name: MaximumTolerableWaterVaporInletPressure
contents.description: The highest water vapor inlet pressure at which a gas ballast pump, under normal ambient conditions, can pump and exhaust pure water vapor in continuous Operation.

contents.name: MaximumWorkingPressure
contents.description: instantaneous inlet pressure with adequate margin above the minimum liquid vapor pressure expected.

contents.name: MinimumAllowableInletPressure
contents.description: Lowest value of inlet pressure at which the pump or component is capable of functioning on the basis of the materials used.

contents.name: NetPositiveInletPressureRequired
contents.description: Total inlet pressure required to ensure there is enough margin to maintain the minimum.

contents.name: WaterVaporCapacity
contents.description: Mass of water which can be conveyed by the pump without condensation per time.

contents.name: MaximumAllowableOutletPressure
contents.description: Highest value of outlet pressure at which the pump or component is capable of functioning on the basis of the materials used.

contents.name: MinimumAllowableOutetPressure
contents.description: Lowest value of outlet pressure at which the pump or component is capable of functioning on the basis of the materials used.

contents.name: OutletAreaOfThePump
contents.description: Free cross-sectional area of the orifice in the outlet connection of the pump.

contents.name: ReliefValveAccumulationPressure
contents.description: Outlet pressure at which the relief valve will pass the total pump flow.

contents.name: ReliefValveBackPressure
contents.description: Pressure at the outlet of the relief valve when the valve is closed.

contents.name: ReliefValveReseatPressure
contents.description: Outlet pressure at which the relief valve will close after passing the total pump flow.

contents.name: ReliefValveSetPressure
contents.description: Outlet pressure at which the relief valve begins to open.

contents.name: NominalSize
contents.description: An alphanumeric designation of size for components of a pipework system, which is used for reference purposes. It comprises the letters DN followed by a dimensionless whole number which is indirectly related to the physical size, in millimeters, of the bore or outside diameter of the end connections.

contents.name: HeightOfTheInletConnection
contents.description: Height of the center of the inlet connection of the pump

contents.name: MeanRatedVelocityAtInlet
contents.description: Rated flow at pump inlet connection divided by the inlet area of the pump

contents.name: RatedInletPressure
contents.description: Inlet pressure of the operating conditions at the guarantee point

contents.name: TotalHeadAtInletAreaOfThePump
contents.description: Head observed at inlet area of the pump, corresponding to the sum of the height, pressure head and velocity head

contents.name: HeightOfTheOutletConnection
contents.description: Height of the center of the outlet connection of the pump.

contents.name: MeanRatedVelocityAtOutlet
contents.description: Rated flow at pump outlet connection divided by the inlet area of the pump.

contents.name: RatedOutletPressure
contents.description: Outlet pressure of the pump at the guarantee point with rated flow and rated speed, as well as rated inlet pressure, for rotodynamic pumps only.

contents.name: TotalHeadAtOutletAreaOfThePump
contents.description: Head observed at outlet area of the pump, corresponding to the sum of the height, pressure head and velocity head.

contents.name: CommandVariable
contents.description: Variable quantity, which is not influenced by the control but is introduced into the control system from outside with the aim of making the final controlled variable follow it in a given relationship

contents.name: ControlDifferenceVariable
contents.description: Difference between the reference variable and the feedback variable

contents.name: ControlledVariable
contents.description: Output variable of the controlled system that will be acted upon by one or more manipulated variables

contents.name: ControllerOutputVariable
contents.description: Output variable of the controlling element, which is deducted from the control difference variable and is also the input variable of the actuator

contents.name: DeadTime
contents.description: In a dead-time element the duration of the time interval by which the output variable is shifted relative to the input variable

contents.name: DerivativeActionCoefficient
contents.description: For a derivative element, the quotient of the value of the output variable to the value of the time derivative of the input variable

contents.name: FeedbackVariable
contents.description: Variable quantity, which represents the controlled variable and is returned to the comparing element

contents.name: FinalControlledVariable
contents.description: Variable quantity which has, or combination of variable quantities which have, to be influenced by the control

contents.name: IntegralActionCoefficient
contents.description: For an integral element, the quotient of the time derivative of the output variable to the fixed value of the input variable

contents.name: ManipulatedVariable
contents.description: Output variable of the controlling system, which is also an input variable of the controlled system

contents.name: OperatingMode
contents.description: Characterization of the way and the extent to which the human operator intervenes in the control equipment

contents.name: ProportionalActionCoefficient
contents.description: For a proportional element, the quotient of the variation of the output variable to the corresponding variation of the input variable

contents.name: ReferenceVariable
contents.description: Input variable to a comparing element in a controlling system, which sets the desired value of the controlled variable and is deducted from the command variable

schemas.description: defines flags for directives on the basis of which conformity was determined
defines flags for the category of explosion protection for devices according to EU Directive 2014/34/EU (ATEX)
defines flags for offerd control modes supported by the manufacturer for the product
defines flags for fieldbuses supported by the manufacturer for the product
defines possible pump types

contents.name: AdditionalFieldbuses
contents.description: Additional fieldbuses supported by the product.

contents.name: BalancingRateOfFlow
contents.description: Rate of flow which is extracted to activate a balance device

contents.name: BasePressure
contents.description: Pressure obtained in the test dome after conditioning the vacuum pump and the test dome

contents.name: ClearanceVolume
contents.description: Volume remaining unswept at the end of the discharge stroke.

contents.name: ClockwiseRotation
contents.description: Direction of rotation in which the shaft is seen to be turning in a clockwise direction when viewing the drive end of the shaft. A 'True' status means that the rotation of pump is clockwise and a 'False' status means that the rotation of pump is anticlockwise.

contents.name: Controllable
contents.description: Indicates whether the product is a controllable pump or a self-controlling pump. A 'True' status means that the pump is controllable and a 'False' status means that the pump is not controllable.

contents.name: Cool_DownTimeForAVaporJetPumpOrADiffusionPump
contents.description: The cool-down time is the time required to cool the propellant from the working temperature to a temperature at which the propellant can be exposed to atmospheric air without risk after the heating has been switched off.

contents.name: Counter_ClockwiseRotation
contents.description: Direction of rotation in which the shaft is seen to be turning in an anticlockwise direction, when viewing the drive end of the shaft. A 'True' status means that the rotation of pump is anticlockwise and a 'False' status means that the rotation of pump is clockwise.

contents.name: CriticalSpeed
contents.description: Speed of rotation at which the frequency of vibration (or its multiples) corresponds to the rotor resonant (lateral or torsional)

contents.name: DeclarationOfConformity
contents.description: Publicly accessible attestation of conformity, commonly available on websites.

contents.name: DeclarationOfConformityAvailable
contents.description: Whether or not a declaration of conformity exists. A 'True' status means that the declaration exists and a 'False' status means that there is no declaration available.

contents.name: DesignAxialLoad
contents.description: Residual axial thrust on the pump rotor on which the thrust-bearing selection is based.

contents.name: DesignRadialLoad
contents.description: Radial load of the pump rotor for which the bearing system is selected.

contents.name: DirectivesOfEUDeclarationOfConformity
contents.description: Set of directives on the basis of which conformity was determined.

contents.name: DryCriticalSpeed
contents.description: Rotor resonant frequency calculated assuming that the rotor is supported only at its bearings and that the bearings are of infinite stiffness

contents.name: ExplosionProtection
contents.description: Device category for explosion protection according to 2014/34/EU (ATEX).

contents.name: GeometricalFlow
contents.description: Product of geometrical displacement volume and speed of rotation or stroke frequency

contents.name: GeometricDisplacementVolume
contents.description: Displacement volume for one stroke or one cycle.

contents.name: HeadAtPeakPoint
contents.description: Highest total head developed by a pump when this does not occur at a zero rate of flow

contents.name: LeakageRateOfFlow
contents.description: Rate of flow leaking from shaft seals

contents.name: MaximumAllowableAmbientTemperature
contents.description: Highest allowable ambient temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

contents.name: MaximumAllowableCasingWorkingPressure
contents.description: Greatest outlet pressure at the specified operating temperature at which the pump casing can be used

contents.name: MaximumAllowableContinuousSpeed
contents.description: Highest rotational speed for continuous operation recommended by the manufacturer

contents.name: MaximumAllowableHead
contents.description: Maximum permissible head at which the pump can be continuously operated without suffering damage

contents.name: MaximumAllowableRelativeHumidity
contents.description: Highest allowable relative humidity for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

contents.name: MaximumAllowableTemperature
contents.description: Highest allowable continuous fluid temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable when handling the specified operating fluid at the specified operating pressure

contents.name: MaximumAllowableThroughput
contents.description: Maximum pV flow the pump can withstand without damage

contents.name: MaximumAllowableWorkingPressure
contents.description: Pressure for a component on the basis of materials used and on the basis of calculation rules at the specified operating temperature

contents.name: MaximumAxialLoad
contents.description: Greatest value of the residual axial thrust on the pump rotor resulting from operating the pump at any condition within its allowable operating range.

contents.name: MaximumPumpPowerInput
contents.description: Highest value of the pump power input at any rate of flow at any allowable operating condition

contents.name: MaximumRadialLoad
contents.description: Greatest radial load of the pump rotor resulting from operating the pump at any condition within its allowable operating range.

contents.name: MaximumStaticSealingPressure
contents.description: Highest pressure, excluding hydrostatic testing, to which the seal can be subjected while the pump is shut down

contents.name: MeanTimebetweenFailures
contents.description: Average of the times between failures.

contents.name: MinimumAllowableAmbientTemperature
contents.description: Lowest allowable ambient temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

contents.name: MinimumAllowableContinuousSpeed
contents.description: Lowest speed for continuous operation recommended by the manufacturer

contents.name: MinimumAllowableHead
contents.description: Minimum permissible head at which the pump can be operated without suffering damage

contents.name: MinimumAllowableRelativeHumidity
contents.description: Lowest allowable relative humidity for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

contents.name: MinimumAllowableTemperature
contents.description: Lowest allowable continuous temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable when handling the specified operating fluid at the specified operating pressure

contents.name: MinimumAllowableThermalFlow
contents.description: Lowest flow at which the pump can operate without its operation being impaired by the temperature rise of the pumped liquid

contents.name: MinimumContinuousStableFlow
contents.description: Lowest flow at which the pump can be operated without it adversely affecting its performance in terms of life expectancy, noise and vibrations

contents.name: MinimumContinuousThermalFlow
contents.description: Lowest flow at which the pump can operate without its operation being impaired by the temperature rise of the pumped liquid

contents.name: NetPositiveSuctionHeadRequired
contents.description: Minimum NPSH at the pump inlet connection required to give the rated or operating performance at the specified conditions

contents.name: NetPositiveSuctionHeadRequiredForADropOf3Percent
contents.description: NPSH required for a drop of 3 % in the total head of the first stage of the pump as a standard basis for use in performance curves

contents.name: OfferedControlModes
contents.description: Control modes supported by the manufacturer for the product.

contents.name: OfferedFieldbuses
contents.description: Fieldbuses supported by the manufacturer for the product.

contents.name: OptimumHead
contents.description: Total head developed by the pump at a rate of flow corresponding to the best efficiency

contents.name: OptimumPumpPowerInput
contents.description: Pump power input at the rate of flow corresponding to the best efficiency

contents.name: OptimumRateOfFlow
contents.description: Rate of flow at the point of best efficiency

contents.name: PistonVelocity
contents.description: Average speed given by the stroke length multiplied with the number of complete pumping cycles of the piston, plunger or piston attached to the diaphragm per minute (stroke per minute or pump crank speed)

contents.name: PossibleFluids
contents.description: Fluids that can be pumped by the pump.

contents.name: Pre_ChargePressure
contents.description: Pressure to which the pulsation dampener is charged with dry gas prior to start of operation

contents.name: PumpClass
contents.description: Pump type according to functional principle and pumped fluid

contents.name: Shut_OffHead
contents.description: Total head developed by the pump in a zero rate of flow

contents.name: Shut_OffPumpPowerInput
contents.description: Pump power input at zero rate of flow

contents.name: SlipFlow
contents.description: Flow lost internally through clearances

contents.name: SoundEnergy
contents.description: Integral of the sound power, P, over a stated time interval of duration T (starting at t1 and ending at t2).

contents.name: SoundEnergyLevel
contents.description: Ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound energy, J, to a reference value, J0, expressed in decibels.

contents.name: SoundPower
contents.description: Through a surface, product of the sound pressure, p, and the component of the particle velocity, un, at a point on the surface in the direction normal to the surface, integrated over that surface.

contents.name: SoundPowerLevel
contents.description: Ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound power of a source, P, to a reference value, P0, expressed in decibels.

contents.name: SoundPressure
contents.description: Difference between instantaneous pressure and static pressure.

contents.name: SoundPressureLevel
contents.description: Ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the square of the sound pressure, p, to the square of a reference value, p0, expressed in decibels.

contents.name: SpecificSpeed
contents.description: Speed that characterizes a pump in terms of its speed, flow rate per impeller eye, i.e. total flow for single-flow impeller, half flow for double-flow impeller, at the best efficiency point and head per stage at maximum impeller diameter

contents.name: StandardGasFlowrate
contents.description: Volume flow rate at standard reference conditions, i.e. 0 C and 101 325 Pa

contents.name: StartingPressure
contents.description: The starting pressure is the pressure at which a vacuum pump can be switched on and a pumping effect is achieved without damage occurring.

contents.name: Suction_SpecificSpeed
contents.description: Speed that characterizes a pump's cavitation performance in terms of its speed, optimum rate of flow per impeller eye at best efficiency point and NPSH3 at best efficiency point for the first stage at maximum impeller diameter

contents.name: SweptVolume
contents.description: Volume traversed by a single stroke of piston, plunger or diaphragm.

contents.name: TripSpeed
contents.description: Speed at which the independent emergency overspeed devices operate to shut down a prime mover

contents.name: TypeNumber
contents.description: Pure number calculated at the point of best efficiency

contents.name: VolumeFlowRate
contents.description: Volume flow rate of the gas removed by the pump from the gas phase within the evacuated chamber.

contents.name: VolumeFlowRateOfBackingPump
contents.description: Maximum volume flow rate for which the conditions are defined in the instruction manual or in a specific standard for the particular vacuum pump

contents.name: WarmUpTimeForAVaporJetPumpOrADiffusionPump
contents.description: The warm-up time is the time required to heat the blowing agent in the boiling vessel to its working temperature. The initial temperature can either be equal to the ambient temperature or equal to the temperature at which the blowing agent of the vacuum pump can be exposed to atmospheric air without risk.

contents.name: WaterVaporTolerableLoad
contents.description: The mass flow rate for water vapor, in a gas ballast pump, in continuous operation and under normal ambient conditions, if the pumped gas is pure water vapor.

contents.name: WetCriticalSpeed
contents.description: Rotor resonant frequency calculated considering the additional support and damping produced by the action of the pumped fluid within rotor

contents.name: InstallationNpshCurve
contents.description: Relationship between the net positive suction head available and the rate of flow at given operating conditions for a given liquid

contents.name: PumpCurve
contents.description: Representation of the pump head plotted against the flow rate

contents.name: PumpEfficiencyCurve
contents.description: Relationship between the pump efficiency and the rate of flow at given operating conditions of speed and liquid

contents.name: PumpH_Q_Curve
contents.description: Relationship between the total head of the pump and the rate of flow at given operating conditions /rated conditions of speed and liquid

contents.name: PumpNpshCurve
contents.description: Relationship between the net positive suction head required and the rate of flow at given operating conditions of speed and liquid

contents.name: PumpPowerInputCurve
contents.description: Relationship between the pump power input and the rate of flow given operating conditions of speed and liquid

contents.name: StablePumpH_Q_Curve
contents.description: Pump H(Q) curve where the maximum head and shut-off head are coincidental, and the total head declines continuously as the rate of flow increases

contents.name: ArrangementsLink
contents.description: Drawing showing replacement components layout for an item.

contents.name: CertificatesLink
contents.description: Specific safety and statutory regulations certificates for items (lifting equipment, steam boilers, pressure vessels,...).

contents.name: CircuitDiagramLink
contents.description: Overall feeder and control circuits diagram.

contents.name: ComponentsListLink
contents.description: Comprehensive list of items which constitute part of another one.

contents.name: DetailLink
contents.description: Drawing with part list to ensure dismantling, repair and assembly of items.

contents.name: DuringMaintenanceServicesRenderedLink
contents.description: Final and/or interim report on services provided

contents.name: ImplementationDescriptionLink
contents.description: Explanation of the work carried out

contents.name: LayoutLink
contents.description: Drawing showing all areas of a particular plant.

contents.name: LocationLink
contents.description: Drawing showing the position of all field items within the considered area.

contents.name: LogicDiagramLink
contents.description: System control diagram to clarify the overall system logic.

contents.name: LubricationMapLink
contents.description: Drawing showing position of each item lubrication point, with lubrication data and specifications.

contents.name: MaintenanceManualLink
contents.description: Technical instructions intended to preserve an item in, or restore it to, a state in which it can perform a required function.

contents.name: OperationManualLink
contents.description: Technical instructions to reach a proper item function performance according to its technical specifications and safety conditions.

contents.name: PersonnelRecordingLink
contents.description: List of all activities (work order) performed by a technician. This list includes a predefined time period

contents.name: PipeAndInstrumentDiagramLink
contents.description: Overall fluid conduction (air, steam, oil, fuel ...), and control diagram.

contents.name: ScopeOfWorkLink
contents.description: The hours worked in the execution of the work order. The type of hours worked should be indicated: normal, in shifts, at night, overtime, etc.

contents.name: SingleLineDiagramLink
contents.description: Overall power distribution diagram (electrical, pneumatic, hydraulic). This kind of diagram includes switchboard circuits.

contents.name: SparePartReferenceLink
contents.description: List of all spare parts used within the scope of the work order

contents.name: StaffLink
contents.description: List of all maintenance workers involved in the execution of the work order

contents.name: TechnicalDataLink
contents.description: Manufacturer`s specification of the item.

contents.name: TestProgramReportLink
contents.description: Commissioning report which demonstrates that an item is in compliance with specifications.

contents.name: UnitMaintenanceReportLink
contents.description: List of work orders for a particular unit. The list is created for a specified period of time

contents.name: CompressionRatio
contents.description: Ratio of the backing pressure, p3, to the inlet pressure, p1, of the vacuum pump without throughput

contents.name: ExplosionZone
contents.description: Categories of explosion zones for devices according to 2014/34/EU (ATEX).

contents.name: Fieldbus
contents.description: Selected fieldbus for the product

contents.name: Fluid
contents.description: Fluid that is handled by the pump at specified operating conditions

contents.name: GasContent
contents.description: Proportion of gaseous substance in the liquid to be pumped, either as a contaminant or as vapor from the main body of liquid

contents.name: HeightOfTheInletSideOfTheInstallation
contents.description: Height of the fluid level on the inlet side of the installation, or in the center of the inlet manifold

contents.name: HeightOfTheOutletSideOfTheInstallation
contents.description: Height of the fluid level on the outlet side of the installation or in the center of the outlet manifold

contents.name: HeightOfThePump
contents.description: Height of the center of the pump

contents.name: MaximumAmbientTemperature
contents.description: Highest ambient temperature to be expected under normal circumstances

contents.name: MaximumFlow
contents.description: Greatest rate of flow which is expected at operating conditions

contents.name: MaximumHead
contents.description: Highest total head developed by a pump at any rate of flow

contents.name: MaximumInletPressure
contents.description: Highest inlet pressure to which the pump is subjected during operation

contents.name: MaximumOutletPressure
contents.description: Maximum possible pressure at outlet, due either to internal energy increase (rotodynamic pumps) or external downstream restrictions (volumetric pumps)

contents.name: MaximumRelativeHumidity
contents.description: Highest relative humidity that can be expected under normal circumstances.

contents.name: MaximumTemperature
contents.description: Highest fluid temperature to be expected under operating conditions

contents.name: MeanTimeBetweenFailures
contents.description: Average of the times between failures

contents.name: MinimumAmbientTemperature
contents.description: Lowest ambient temperature to be expected under normal circumstances

contents.name: MinimumFlow
contents.description: Smallest rate of flow which is expected at operating conditions

contents.name: MinimumHead
contents.description: Smallest total head developed by a pump at any rate of flow

contents.name: MinimumInletPressure
contents.description: Lowest inlet pressure that can occur during operation for the pump

contents.name: MinimumOutletPressure
contents.description: Lowest outlet pressure that can occur during operation for the pump

contents.name: MinimumRelativeHumidity
contents.description: Lowest relative humidity to be expected under normal circumstances.

contents.name: MinimumTemperature
contents.description: Lowest fluid temperature to be expected under operating conditions

contents.name: Multi_Phase
contents.description: Comprising a fluid together with substances in solid or gaseous states, whether due to deliberate addition or a change of state caused by a change in conditions. A 'True' status means that there is a possibility of multi-phase-fluid and a 'False' status means that there is no possibility of multi-phase-fluid.

contents.name: NetPositiveInletPressureAvailable
contents.description: Total pressure (including velocity pressure) at the pump inlet connection less the liquid vapor pressure at the present temperature of the liquid

contents.name: NormalFlow
contents.description: Rate of flow at which usual operation is expected

contents.name: NpshDatumPlane
contents.description: Horizontal plane through the center of the circle described by the external points of the entrance edges of the impeller blades, in the first stage in the case of multi-stage pumps

contents.name: OperatingMode
contents.description: Specifies whether the pump is to be operated in single, parallel or series connection.

contents.name: RatedInletPressureOfTheInstallation
contents.description: Inlet pressure of the installation for the working conditions

contents.name: RatedPumpUnitTotalHead
contents.description: Difference of the total head, at the outlet side of the pump unit from the total head at the inlet side of the pump unit, at which usual operation is expected

contents.name: ReferencePlane
contents.description: Any horizontal plane for use as the datum for height measurement

contents.name: RequiredControlMode
contents.description: Specifies which control mode is to be used for the use case.

contents.name: RequiredTime
contents.description: Time interval throughout which an item is required to be in an up state

contents.name: SolidContent
contents.description: Proportion of solids contained in the fluid to be pumped, either as a contaminant or as a deliberate useful burden or suspension

contents.name: Throughput
contents.description: Amount of fluid flowing through a duct

contents.name: UltimatePressureOfAVacuumPump
contents.description: The ultimate pressure is the value to which the pressure in a standardized test dome approaches asymptotically during normal operation of the vacuum pump and without gas inlet. A difference can be made between the final pressure caused by gases and the final pressure caused by gases and vapors.

contents.name: WorkingTemperature
contents.description: Temperature determined by the given application and fluid.

contents.name: X_1XPhase
contents.description: Phase of the 1X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

contents.name: X_1XRelativeShaftVibrationP_P
contents.description: Oscillation range at the rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement.

contents.name: X_2XPhase
contents.description: Phase of the 2X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

contents.name: X_2XRelativeShaftVibrationP_P
contents.description: Oscillation range at the double rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement.

contents.name: BearingIndex
contents.description: Amplitude of the oscillation envelope after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

contents.name: BearingIndexPerG
contents.description: Amplitude of the oscillation envelope after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

contents.name: BroadbandCavitationAccelerationPerG_RMS
contents.description: Root mean square of the oscillation signal due to cavitation within a defined frequency range, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The frequency range is regularly defined by the user.

contents.name: BroadbandCavitationAccelerationRMS
contents.description: Root mean square of the oscillation signal due to cavitation within a defined frequency range, expressed as acceleration. The frequency range is regularly defined by the user.

contents.name: GapVoltage
contents.description: Sum value of the oscillation ranges of the vibration at all frequencies except the rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement. Regularly, only the frequency range below the rotational frequency is considered.

contents.name: Not1XRelativeShaftVibrationP_P
contents.description: Phase of the 2X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

contents.name: OverallVibrationAcceleration0_P
contents.description: Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as acceleration. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationAccelerationP_P
contents.description: Oscillation range, expressed as acceleration. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationAccelerationPerG0_P
contents.description: Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationAccelerationPerG_RMS
contents.description: Root mean square of the oscillation displacement, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g

contents.name: OverallVibrationAccelerationPerGP_P
contents.description: Oscillation range, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationAccelerationRMS
contents.description: Root mean square of the oscillation displacement, expressed as acceleration

contents.name: OverallVibrationDisplacementP_P
contents.description: Oscillation range, expressed as local displacement. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationDisplacementRMS
contents.description: Root mean square of oscillation range, expressed as local displacement. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationVelocity0_P
contents.description: Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as velocity. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationVelocityP_P
contents.description: Oscillation range, expressed as velocity. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

contents.name: OverallVibrationVelocityRMS
contents.description: Root mean square of the oscillation displacement expressed as velocity

contents.name: ReferenceStandardForVibrationMeasurement
contents.description: Standard to which statements on vibration measurement refer.

contents.name: RotationalPhase1X
contents.description: Phase of the vibration amplitude at the rotation frequency (1X) of the object under consideration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

contents.name: RotationalPhase2X
contents.description: Phase of the vibration amplitude at the first harmonic of the rotation frequency (2X) of the object under consideration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

contents.name: SpeedOfRotation
contents.description: Number of revolutions per time.

contents.name: ThrustPosition
contents.description: Measure for the distance between the sensor and the shaft, expressed as device output voltage

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheBearingDefectFrequencies
contents.description: Amplitude of the oscillation envelope at the roller bearing defect frequencies after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheBearingDefectFrequenciesPerG
contents.description: Amplitude of the oscillation envelope at the roller bearing defect frequencies after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheBladePassFrequency
contents.description: Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft multiplied with the number of blades mounted at the shaft, expressed as velocity.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheFirstHarmonicOfTheRotationFrequency2X
contents.description: Oscillation amplitude at the double rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheGearMeshingFrequency
contents.description: Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft, multiplied with the number of teeth of the gear mounted at the shaft, expressed as acceleration.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheGearMeshingFrequencyPerG
contents.description: Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft, multiplied with the number of teeth of the gear mounted at the shaft, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheHarmonicsOfTheRotationFrequencyNx
contents.description: Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the harmonics of the rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheRotationFrequency1X
contents.description: Oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheSidebandsOfTheGearMeshingFrequency
contents.description: Root mean square of the oscillation signal within defined frequency ranges, which include the side bands of the mesh frequency above and below the mesh frequency, expressed as acceleration.

contents.name: VibrationAmplitudeAtTheSidebandsOfTheGearMeshingFrequencyPerG
contents.description: Root mean square of the oscillation signal within defined frequency ranges, which include the side bands of the mesh frequency above and below the mesh frequency, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g.

schemas.description: determines whether the port is an inlet and outlet or both

contents.name: Category
contents.description: The category property describes the Port type. The value of this attribute is user-defined. Only ports with the same category value are allowed to be connected.

contents.name: Direction
contents.description: Ports with the direction In can only be connected to ports with the direction Out or InOut and ports with the direction Out can only be connected with ports with the direction In or InOut. Ports with the direction InOut can be connected to Ports of arbitrary direction.

contents.name: IdCarrier
contents.description: This property contains the ID of the asset to which the port is assigned.
